sentences.en: Bandwagon effects may a long way away from fair value.
sentences.cn: 从众效应(Bandwagoneffects)可能会让市场严重偏离公允价值.

sentences.en: He joined the prime minister's bandwagon.
I'm heartily sick of the cult of bandwagon personalities.
sentences.cn: 我对崇拜得势人物的行为十分反感.

sentences.en: Is a jump on the bandwagon the actual is the same.
sentences.cn: 就是赶时髦,实际是一样的.

sentences.en: Jumped the sinking roma ship and hopped aboard the milan bandwagon?
sentences.cn: 从坠落的罗马战舰跳到米兰阵营?

sentences.en: Many farms are jumping on the bandwagon and advertising organically grown food.
sentences.cn: 很多农场正赶潮流宣传有机食品。

sentences.en: More people were jumping on the bandwagon each day.
sentences.cn: 每天都有更多的人严厉批评这股潮流.

sentences.en: Polls are accused of creating a bandwagon effect to benefit their candidate.
sentences.cn: 有人控诉说,他们所做的民意调查是为了给他们的候选人制造声势.

sentences.en: Should you jump on the bandwagon and trade stocks in the news?
sentences.cn: 你会不会根据新闻的线索见风使舵来炒股 呢 ?

sentences.en: So what is really happening as the information bandwagon starts to roll?
sentences.cn: 当信息大潮滚滚而来的时候究竟发生了些什么呢？

sentences.en: Sometimes you just can't jump on the bandwagon.
sentences.cn: 有时候你就是不能随大流.

sentences.en: The keep-fit bandwagon started rolling in the mid-80s.
sentences.cn: 八十年代中期，健身热潮开始涌现。

sentences.en: The World Cup bandwagon is starting to roll.
sentences.cn: 世界杯足球赛热潮即将涌起。

sentences.en: When they saw how things were going everybody jumped on the bandwagon.
sentences.cn: 看清趋势之后,每个人都倒向了胜利者的一边.

sentences.en: While prices are rising so fast, many shops think they can climb on the bandwagon and raise their prices, too.
sentences.cn: 正当此价格飞涨的时候, 许多商店认为可以趁势提高商品价格.

words.tran_cn: 乐队指挥；军乐队或管乐队首度

phrases.tran_cn: 站在某人一边；赶浪头；一窝蜂做某事，跟随潮流
[口语](选举中)站在有胜利希望的一边，支持占优势的一方；看风使舵，随大流

trans.tran_cn: 时尚，浪潮，[音乐]乐队彩车，[非正式用语] 引导车，[非正式用语]潮流
trans.tran_en: an activity that a lot of people are doing
